title: concat tensor
body_html:
Hi all,

I have two tensors of different dimensions:
A = tensor([[-1.9314, -1.9754, -1.9867, -2.2567, -2.2533, -2.2397],
[-1.9754, -1.9867, -1.9641, -2.2533, -2.2397, -2.2318]])
B = tensor([-2.2320, -2.2240])

I want to create a new tensor that looks like this:
C = tensor([[-1.9314, -1.9754, -1.9867, -2.2567, -2.2533, -2.2397], [-2.2320],
[-1.9754, -1.9867, -1.9641, -2.2533, -2.2397, -2.2318], [-2.2240]])
In Python I can easily do it with looping:
C = []
for i in range(len(A)):
C.append([A[i],B[i]])

Any idea, the Pytorch way to do it?
body_text:
Hi all,
I have two tensors of different dimensions:
A = tensor([[-1.9314, -1.9754, -1.9867, -2.2567, -2.2533, -2.2397],
[-1.9754, -1.9867, -1.9641, -2.2533, -2.2397, -2.2318]])
B = tensor([-2.2320, -2.2240])
I want to create a new tensor that looks like this:
C = tensor([[-1.9314, -1.9754, -1.9867,  -2.2567, -2.2533, -2.2397], [-2.2320],
[-1.9754, -1.9867, -1.9641,  -2.2533, -2.2397, -2.2318], [-2.2240]])
In Python I can easily do it with looping:
C = []
for i in range(len(A)):
C.append([A[i],B[i]])
Any idea, the Pytorch way to do it?
body:
Hi all,

I have two tensors of different dimensions:
A = tensor([[-1.9314, -1.9754, -1.9867, -2.2567, -2.2533, -2.2397],
        [-1.9754, -1.9867, -1.9641, -2.2533, -2.2397, -2.2318]])
B = tensor([-2.2320, -2.2240])

I want to create a new tensor that looks like this:
C = tensor([[-1.9314, -1.9754, -1.9867,  -2.2567, -2.2533, -2.2397], [-2.2320],
        [-1.9754, -1.9867, -1.9641,  -2.2533, -2.2397, -2.2318], [-2.2240]])
In Python I can easily do it with looping:
C = []
for i in range(len(A)):
        C.append([A[i],B[i]])

Any idea, the Pytorch way to do it?
